title: Are Amazon products delivered correctly on the estimated delivery date? - Quora

response.answer_text: NO The date given to you is estimated delivery date, not a guaranteed date. EDD (in short) is calculated with regards to normal delivery time taken to deliver a product to your doorstep. A lot of time, things don't happen in normal way which causes delay in delivery. But in most cases these aberration are taken into consideration while deciding EDD which is why the product reaches to you earlier than date notified. The factors that e-commerce companies consider while deciding dates are - Delivery distance (from hub, local collection center, etc)ConnectivityCourier partners availabilityCostE-commerce companies also work on the same principle as airline companies do. They always tell you the time after including loss of time due to unforeseen events and then they delight you by showing that they did everything on time. For eg - the flight time between Bhopal and Delhi is 1.5 hours and the distance is 700kms. We know that planes operate at 500–900 kmph. Thus actual time should be less than an hour but if company says duration is less than 1 hour and flight lose time due to traffic or weather, then customers will be angry about wrong information about duration. In a nutshell, the EDD is not a perfect date for delivery.

No. It is normally always earlier than expected but, things happen. Delivery is not guaranteed 100 percent in any case ( whatever company). But, if we’re talking about reliability of delivering products to the consumers, I would say, Amazon is one of the best there is in exceeding customer expectations. Of course, life happens and that’s where the expectations fall below and it sucks if that small percentage happens to you just like it did with me. Have had items didn’t arrive and wrong items at times. All you gotta do is contact the customer service in the website and 99.9% of the time, your concerns will be resolved. Goodluck and God bless

Our (Me and family) personal experience has been super fab with Amazon India (www.amazon.in). Not only do they deliver latest by the date they propose but 90% of the times, delivery is much much earlier and that’s true delight :) Infact, we have subscribed to their Prime membership and so most of the times delivery is free and usually on the next day itself, worst case 2–3 days down (but still within proposed date) Only one observation I have had last two or three times -that their delivery partners (courier guys) sometimes fake a delivery attempt late in the evening (they say they tried to deliver without even bothering to ) which is detrimental to Amazon’s brand image. Otherwise we are great fans and loyal Amazon Clients :-)

I’ve only ever had a real problem with one delivery and that was nearly two years ago. I check the estimated delivery date BEFORE I place the order. If it isn’t what I want, I don’t order. The Amazon orders of mine (of which there were almost 200 last year), have always arrived at my doorstep on time, or even sometimes a day early!

Usually items at Amazon get delivered to you on or before the Estimated Delivery date but in some unavoidable circumstances the packages get delayed due to various reasons but you can be assured on the part you will be surely notified on every delivery action been taken for your order delivery as you can track the parcel and if there is any sort of delay it gets updated on tracking or you also get notified via email in some cases.

Most of the time it does. Amazon place and ship your orders on time but sometimes once the courier service receive the package, the delivery people cause additional nuisance by not delivering the product on time and updating the fake information that customer address was’t located and hence the delivery will be attempted next day. I saw plenty of such cases while working as a CSR at Amazon.

Not always, because we live in a physical reality and there are human beings involved, so real world things like a flat tyre or a person who is having a bad day making a mistake will always happen sooner or later.
